definition: to be needy or destitute

to have or feel need                                      
             
             never wants for friends
to be necessary or needed

to desire to come, go, or be                                      
             
             the cat wants in

to fail to possess especially in customary or required amount : lack                                      
             
             the answer wanted courtesy

to have a strong desire for                                      
             
             wanted a chance to rest

to have an inclination to : like                                      
             
             say what you want, he is efficient

to have need of : require                                      
             
             the motor wants a tune-up

to suffer from the lack of                                      
             
             thousands still want food and shelter

ought                                      
                
                  —used with the infinitive          you want to be very careful what you say— Claudia Cassidy
to wish or demand the presence of

to hunt or seek in order to apprehend                                      
             
             wanted for murder

deficiency, lack                                      
             
             suffers from a want of good sense
grave and extreme poverty that deprives one of the necessities of life
something wanted : need, desire
personal defect : fault
to desire or wish for (something)
to need (something)
to be without (something needed)
the state or condition of not having any or enough of something
something that is desired or needed
the state or condition of being poor

to desire, wish, or long for something                                      
             
             I want to go home.

to feel or suffer the need of something                                      
                   
             … such a ghastly brew as to make me want to swoon.

to be without : lack                                      
             
             Luckily, my family does not want much.

lack entry 2, shortage                                      
             
             His actions show a want of common sense.

the state of being very poor                                      
             
             They died in want.
a wish for something : desire

craves sweets
covets his rise to fame
the extreme poverty of the slum dwellers
the indigence of her years as a graduate student
a catastrophic illness that condemned them to years of penury
lived in a perpetual state of want
the widespread destitution in countries beset by famine

definition: to feel that you would like to have, keep, or do something
to feel that you would like someone to do something or would like something to happen
to feel that you would like someone or something to be in a particular place or doing a particular job
to ask for someone because you would like to see or speak to them
to need something
if something wants doing, it needs to be done
to deserve something
to feel that you would like to have sex with someone
Adverbs
want
definitely, desperately, genuinely, obviously, particularly, really
in: Do you still want these old letters?
want something for something: What do you want for your birthday?
want to do something: Liz wants to see the gardens.
want someone/something to do something: Her parents didn’t want her to marry him.
want something of/from someone: I wish I knew exactly what they wanted of me.
want something done: Mrs Miller wants the entire house repainted.
I want those boxes out of the living room by tomorrow!
We want Stephen as chairman.
Mum wants you – she’s in the kitchen.
You’re wanted on the telephone.
The head wants you in her office after school.
We desperately want rain.
She wants help if she’s going to sort out her financial problems.
You won’t want much money on a camping holiday.
The supper dishes want washing.
This bill wants paying.
That rascal! He wants a good kick up the backside!
She wanted him more than ever.
Mourinho only had respect for European winners, and he desperately wanted to win with Chelsea.
all someone wants
be/have everything someone wants
do you want something?
have someone just where you want them
if you want
if you want my advice/opinion
I want...
I want to say/thank/tell etc
I wanted...
just what I (have always) wanted
not want to be/appear/sound etc
want nothing more (than)
what does someone want with something?
what do you want?
who wants (to do) something?
you want/don’t want to do something

definition: to wish for a particular thing or plan of action. "Want" is not used in polite requests:
to wish or need someone to be present:
to want to start or stop being involved in something:
to need something:
used in giving advice to mean that someone should do something:
a lack of something:
needing:
needs:
to feel that you would like to have something or would like something to happen:
If you are wanted, someone wishes to see or talk with you:
in: I want some chocolate.

definition: desire or wish for possession or presence of something

Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
have a desire to possess or do (something); wish for.
To feel a desire or urge for something; to feel a lust toward.
